p:
This study confirmed subtype A as the most prevalent subtype, which has maintained a high rate of infections in the DRC over the last three decades
61 , explaining the high rate of URF carrying subtype A fragments circulating in Kinshasa described in the last years. Kinshasa has been proposed as the origin of A, G and F1 subtypes
28 , common found HIV-1 variants in our series. Although subtype D was associated with faster disease progression
13 , was also initially emerged in Kinshasa, its prevalence decreased in the city during 2016â€“2018 compared to previous years. Although a significant increase of subtype C was reported from 1997 to 2002 in Kinshasa
38 , in other countries close to the DRC
62 and worldwide
15 , we observed a similar prevalence of this variant in Kinshasa comparing the two time periods under study. The reasons for these findings are unknown.
